idKeys.description: Trees found in gardens and urban areas
Trees with leaves that are needle-like or scale-like
Trees with broad leaves, arranged opposite each other in pairs
Trees with leaves arranged alternately, divided into separate leaflets
Evergreen trees with leaves arranged alternately, not divided into leaflets
Deciduous trees with leaves arranged alternately, not divided into leaflets; fruits fleshy or juicy
Deciduous trees with leaves arranged alternately, not divided into leaflets; fruits dry

data.description: Types of tree found in gardens and urban areas

options.text: Leaves needle-like or scale-like and often overlapping
Leaves not needle-like, scale-like or overlapping
Leaves in pairs, opposite each other on shoots
Leaves alternate on shoots
Leaves divided into separate leaflets
Leaves with one blade, possibly indented into lobes, but not divided into leaflets
Leaves evergreen
Leaves deciduous
Fruits fleshy or juicy
Fruits dry

data.description: Trees with leaves that are needle-like or scale-like

options.text: All leaves scale-like, usually pressed against the twig
All leaves needle-like, usually spread widely apart
Some leaves scale-like, others needle-like
Scale-leaves at least 30mm long, rigid and sharp-edged
Scale-leaves less than 30mm long, not rigid or sharp
Deciduous tree; foliage is wispy; pink or white flowers
Evergreen tree with cones; foliage is dense
Cone is egg-shaped with overlapping scales, eventually widespreading like petals of a flower; crushed foliage smells of pineapple
Cone is egg- or ball-shaped, scales meet at edges and don’t overlap, scales don’t become widespreading; crushed foliage doesn’t smell of pineapple
Cone is egg-shaped with more than 15 scales; bark is very thick, with visible fibres, and is rather soft or spongy
Cone is ball-shaped, with fewer than 10 scales; bark is hard
Needles are in two flat, parallel rows, at least on the short shoots growing off longer ones; fruit is scarlet and berry-like
All the needles are in clusters or are parted on either side of shoot, but not in flat rows; fruit is a woody cone
Needles are all on their own at their position on the shoot
Most needles grouped around the shoot, in pairs or bundles of 2 or more
Cones stand upright on branches; needles are attached by a suckerlike base
Cones hang downwards from branches; the base of the needles are not sucker-like
Needles leave behind their peg-like bases after falling
Needles leave behind their cushionlike bases after falling
Most needles are in bundles of 2–5
Most needles are arranged around the shoot in clusters of 3, 10 or more, rarely in pairs
Needles in bundles of 2
Needles in bundles of 3
Needles in bundles of 5
Needles on all shoots are arranged in rings of 3 going around the shoot, or occasionally in pairs
Needles on short shoots, in clusters of 10 or more
A deciduous tree; the cones are egg-shaped
An evergreen tree; the cones are barrel-shaped
Leaves of main shoots are scale-like, leaves of short shoots are needlelike, up to 20mm long, arranged in 2 rows; foliage doesn’t smell unpleasant
Leaves mostly scale-like; those towards the tips of shoots are needle-like, in opposite pairs, 5–6mm long; crushed foliage smells unpleasant

data.description: Trees with broad leaves, arranged opposite each other in pairs

options.text: Leaves palmately divided into separate leaflets, the leaflets extending from the leaf stalk
Leaves pinnately divided into separate leaflets, the leaflets in two rows on the stalk
Leaves are sometimes lobed, but are not divided into leaflets
Small trees with ridged, corky bark; the fruit is a berry
Tall trees with smooth or slightly wrinkled bark; fruits are dry and wing-shaped
Twigs are clearly flattened where the buds or leaves are attached; leaves are hairy on the underside; 1 fruit per stalk
Twigs are not flattened where the buds or leaves are attached; leaves are hairless on the underside; fruits in pairs on the stalks
Flowers have no petals; winter buds are black
Flowers have narrow white petals; winter buds are grey or brown
Leaves are deeply palmately lobed; fruits are wing-shaped and in pairs
Leaves are not lobed or are only very shallowly lobed; fruit is either a woody capsule, a berry or a long, narrow pod
Leaf edges are toothed
Leaf edges are not toothed
An evergreen tree, leaves are usually bluish-green and smell of eucalyptus when crushed; bark is usually shredding or flaking
A deciduous tree, leaves are pale or bright green and don’t smell when crushed; bark is not shredding
A tall tree up to 20m; leaves are 10–25cm long; flowers are 5cm or more across; fruit is a long, narrow pod that remains after the leaves fall
A small tree to 8m; leaves are 4–10cm long; flowers are 4mm across; fruit is a red berry
Leaves with 3-13 lobes. If 5-lobed, then any teeth present aren’t small, coarse, round-tipped and numerous, or flowers/fruits don’t hang in tails
Leaves 5-lobed with many small, coarse, round-tipped teeth; flowers/fruits in hanging tails

data.description: Trees with leaves arranged alternately, divided into separate leaflets

options.text: Leaves divided into 3 leaflets
Leaves divided into more than 3 leaflets
Twigs are thick and densely covered with velvety hairs; flower heads (and later the seed heads) are dense, cone-shaped and hairy
Twigs not velvety; flowers and fruits are not in hairy, cone-shaped heads
Twigs have a pair of thorns at the base of each leaf
Twigs have no spines or thorns
Twigs have distinctive Y-shaped scars where leaves have fallen; cut twigs leak latex; flowers are in catkins or clusters of 1–5
Leaf scars are not Y-shaped; cut twigs don’t leak latex; flowers are numerous and in clusters
Leaflets are not lobed, they are not foul-smelling; the fruit is a pod
Leaflets have a few teeth or lobes in the lower half only and they are foulsmelling when crushed; the fruit is a papery, winged seed
Leaflets are toothed or lobed, not foul-smelling; the fruit is a papery capsule
Leaflets are toothed at least in the upper half and are not foul-smelling; fruit is juicy and berry-like
Lower part of the leaf is divided into 1–4 pairs of leaflets, the upper part is lobed in places but not completely divided
Leaves are completely divided into 6 or more pairs of leaflets
Ripe fruits are orange-red to vermillion-red or occasionally yellow, with yellow pulp
options.answer: Rowans with orange or vermillion fruit

options.text: Ripe fruits are white to pink or crimson, with white pulp
options.answer: Rowan with white, pink or crimson fruit

data.description: Evergreen trees with leaves arranged alternately, not divided into leaflets

options.text: Leaves have spiny edges
Leaves sometimes have toothed edges but are not spiny
Leaves are white- or green-felted on the underside; fruit is an acorn; flowers are green, the male flowers are in slender catkins
Leaves are paler but hairless on the underside; fruit is a berry; flowers are white and in small clusters
Leaves are aromatic when crushed
Leaves are not aromatic when crushed
Leaves smell of eucalyptus when crushed, or rarely of lemon, the edges are flat
Leaves smell of almonds when crushed; the edges are rolled under
Leaves smell of bay when crushed, the edges are wavy
Leaves are densely covered with rusty brown or grey hairs on the underside
Leaves are hairless or have white hairs on the underside
Flowers are on their own
Flowers are in clusters
Flowers are roughly 1cm long, urn-shaped and in small drooping clusters; the fruit is a warty, mattred berry
Flowers are 3–5.5cm long, bellshaped and in large rounded clusters; the fruit is a capsule
Flowers are 1–1.5cm across and flat, with up to 100 in erect spikes; the fruit is a smooth, shiny black berry
Flowers are less than 1cm across, flat and in clusters; the fruit is a red, orange or blue-black berry

data.description: Deciduous trees with leaves arranged alternately, not divided into leaflets; fruits fleshy or juicy

options.text: Leaves are fan-shaped with a central notch
Leaves are not fan-shaped
At least some leaves are lobed
Leaves are undivided, the edges may be toothed but not lobed
Leaves are palmately lobed, distinctly bristly to the touch on the upper side
Leaves are pinnately lobed, smooth or softly hairy on the upper side
Some leaves are lobed and all are toothed; the fruit resembles a raspberry, red or purple when ripe
All leaves are lobed; the fruit is pearshaped and brownish purple when ripe
Twigs are thorny
Twigs are not thorny
Leaves are not toothed
Leaves are toothed
Flowers and fruits are in cylinder- or cone-shaped spikes
Flowers and fruits are on their own, in pairs or in clusters
Flowers are less than 10mm in diameter, the petals are broadly oval; the fruit is smooth at the apex
Flowers are more than 10mm in diameter, the petals are narrow and strap-shaped; the fruit is crowned with the withered sepals
Flowers have 1 style; sepals are absent on the ripe fruit; 1 seed
Flowers have 2 or more styles; sepals are usually present on the ripe fruit; 2 or more seeds
Twigs are very thorny
Twigs are not thorny or have only occasional thorns
Fruit is less than 2cm long; the bark often has distinctive horizontal bands of pores
Fruit is more than 2cm long; the bark doesn’t have horizontal bands of pores
Fruit has a velvety skin, even when fully ripe
Fruit has a smooth skin, often with a greyish waxy bloom on the skin
Young twigs are green, smooth and glossy
Young twigs are brown or grey, dull and often hairy
Flowers and fruits in clusters of 11 or more, with their stalks not arising from a central point
Flowers and fruits in clusters of 10 or fewer, with their stalks all arising from a central point
Twigs are thorny or spiny, sometimes with very few spines
Twigs are not thorny
Fruit is usually pear-shaped, with gritty flesh; styles are not joined together at the base
Fruit is usually apple-shaped, the flesh is not gritty; styles are joined together at the base
Fruits less than 4cm long
Fruits more than 4cm long

data.description: Deciduous trees with leaves arranged alternately, not divided into leaflets; fruits dry

options.text: Leaves are lobed
Leaves are not lobed
Leaves are square or notched at the tip; the flowers are up to 5cm long and are on their own
Leaves are rounded or pointed at the tip; the flowers are much smaller, in clusters or catkins
Leaves are pinnately lobed; the fruit is an acorn
Leaves are palmately or irregularly lobed; the fruits form a catkin or globe-shaped head
Leaves are felted with white or grey hairs on the underside
Leaves are smooth or sparsely hairy on the underside
Bark is flaking in large patches; the fruits form a soft, hairy ball like a pom-pom
Bark is fissured, not flaking; the fruits form a stiff, spiky ball like the head of a mace
Bark is silver or white
Bark is greyish or brown
Tree is weeping, the twigs and smaller branches hang loosely; the bark has black, diamond-shaped splits
Tree is not weeping; the bark is often peeling but doesn’t have black diamond-shaped splits
Leaves are more than 3 times as long as they are wide
Leaves are less than 3 times as long as they are wide
Leaf edges are coarsely toothed, the teeth end in a softly spiny tip; the seeds are enclosed in a softly spiny husk
Leaf edges are not indented but may have small, fine teeth; the seeds have a plume of silky hairs at one end
Tree is weeping, the smaller branches hang downwards, often almost to the ground
Tree is not weeping
Fruit is a small, woody cone, they are numerous and stay on the tree until spring
Fruit is not a woody cone
Leaf edges aren’t indented
Leaf edges are toothed, the teeth may be very small
Leaves are double-toothed
Leaves are almost circular; flowers are pea-like and found on the trunk and main branches as well as the twigs
Leaves are oval or egg-shaped; flowers aren’t pea-like
Leaves are flat and 15cm or more in length; the flowers have 5 or more large petals that are white or pink; the fruit is cone-like but not woody
Leaves are up to 9cm long with wavy edges; the flowers are greenish and don’t have petals; the fruit has a spiny husk
Flowers and fruits are in clusters suspended beneath an oblong, wing-shaped bract; the leaves are roughly heart-shaped
Flowers and fruits are in cylindrical catkins; the leaves are oval to oblong
Flowers are in small clusters; the fruit is a seed surrounded by a papery wing
Flowers are in slender, hanging catkins; the fruit is a nut
Leaves hairy on both surfaces; fruits are solitary or in clusters of a few; each nut is wrapped in a leafy sheath
Leaves hairy only on veins on the underside; fruits are in a hanging catkin, paired nuts are attached to a large, 3-lobed, bract
Flowers or fruits arranged in roughly cylinder-shaped spikes, 11 or more per spike
Flowers or fruits on their own or in clusters of 10 or fewer
Leaves hairless or with white hairs along midrib, sometimes only where veins join; flowers 10-15mm across
Leaves have rusty or orange hairs underneath, each side of the midrib; flowers 8mm across
Flower and leaf stalks densely hairy; leaf edges have pointed teeth
Flower and leaf stalks hairless or almost hairless; leaf edges have pointed teeth, often with thin, bristle-like tips
Flower and leaf stalks hairless; leaf edges have blunt or round teeth, often with a claw-shaped gland at the tip
Sepal edges are toothed; leaves hairless on the upper side with hairy veins on the underside
Sepal edges not toothed; leaves hairy on both surfaces
Bark on trunk and branches very glossy, purplish-brown and peeling in thin, copper-brown strips
Bark mostly dull grey or brown, sometimes peeling to reveal shiny red-brown on the trunk
Flowers less than 20mm across, on stalks up to 15mm long, not arising from a central point; fruit less than 10mm long
Flowers more than 20mm across, on stalks more than 15mm long, arising from a central point; fruit more than 10mm long
Flowers cup-shaped; leaves dull on the upper side, sparsely hairy on the underside
Flowers saucer-shaped; leaves glossy on the upper side, hairless on the underside
